00900_mcGetSessionErrorCode
Normal_Client_API

Detailed Description

Involved Components and their required Functionality

  1. ClientLib
    1. Can connect to daemon
    2. Can reserve memory for connection
  2. McDriverDaemon
    1. Daemon running
    2. Daemon socket accessible by TLC
    3. mcOpenDevice()
  3. McDriverModule
    1. Module loaded
    2. Module socket accessible by daemon
    3. Module listens for connection
  4. Trusted Application TlIntegrationTest
    1. Trusted Application copied to Android on Test device in registry as 05010000000000000000000000000000.trst
    2. Trusted Application runnable and bug-free

Generic preconditions (setup)
Generic Preconditions are the same for every test case. They are executed always in front of every single test case.

  • open device using the default ID by calling mcOpenDevice()
  • allocate a WSM buffer (4k)
  • open a session to the Trusted Application

Generic post processing (teardown)
Generic post processing is the same for every test case. It is executed always after every single test case.

  • close session to the Trusted Application
  • free allocated memory of WSM buffer
  • close Device by calling mcCloseDevice()

Function Documentation

TestCase_GC00050_NoNotifications ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
05010000000000000000000000000000
Focus:
mcGetSessionErrorCode() returns MC_DRV_OK if there is no error.
Test Steps:
Ensures that no session error is returned if there is none. mcGetSessionErrorCode() returns MC_DRV_OK.
No additional error code is set.
Test output is OK.
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
Yes
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
Yes
Quick Testcase:
No
Test ID:
Normal_Client_API.00900_mcGetSessionErrorCode.GC00050_NoNotifications
TestCase_GC00100_MultipleNotifications ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
05010000000000000000000000000000
Focus:
mcWaitNotification handles 3 notifications of trusted application.
Test Steps:
Ensures that trusted application Connector handles multiple notification of test trusted application successfully. mcWaitNotification() returns MC_DRV_OK.
Response ID is set in message header on TCI.
No additional error code is set.
Test output is OK.
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
Yes
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
Yes
Quick Testcase:
No
Test ID:
Normal_Client_API.00900_mcGetSessionErrorCode.GC00100_MultipleNotifications
TestCase_GC00101_TrustletExits ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
05010000000000000000000000000000
Focus:
mcGetSessionErrorCode is ERR_INVALID_EXIT_CODE as the last error.
Test Steps:
Trusted Application Connector handles the "last" notification of the Trusted Application after the Trusted Application terminates itself with a wrong exit code. mcWaitNotification() returns MC_DRV_INFO_NOTIFICATION.
The additional error code is set to -1: invalid exit code.
Test output is OK.
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
Yes
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
Yes
Quick Testcase:
No
Test ID:
Normal_Client_API.00900_mcGetSessionErrorCode.GC00101_TrustletExits
TestCase_GC00103_TrustletCrashes ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
05010000000000000000000000000000
Focus:
mcGetSessionErrorCode() returns "ERR_INVALID_OPERATION"
Test Steps:
Trusted Application Connector handles the notification of the TL after the TL causes a kernel exception. mcWaitNotification() returns MC_DRV_INFO_NOTIFICATION.
Test output is OK.
Manual Execution:
No
